conclusion: Determine induced emf in two configurations using Faraday's law and motional emf.
Configuration 1: Straight metal rod moving perpendicular to magnetic field and its length with velocity v.
Configuration 2: Rod bent into two equal-length segments at right angle, moving along angle bisector with velocity v.
Induced emf in Configuration 1 is calculated as ε = B L v.
Calculate effective perpendicular length for each segment in Configuration 2 as L/2 cos(45°).
Total effective length L' perpendicular to velocity is L cos(45°).
Substitute cos(45°) = √2/2 to find L' = L√2/2.
Induced emf in Configuration 2 is ε' = B L' v = B (L√2/2) v = B L v √2/2.
Find ratio ε'/ε = (B L v √2/2) / (B L v) = √2/2.
